title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 December 2015 - XWiki
content:
<benoitc\_> has joined #xwiki  
03:14 <benoitc\_> has quit  
07:36 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:49 <cjd> has quit  
08:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <Pbas> @ClemensR Good morning I loop on activity events with foreach ($MonEvent in $xwiki.activitystream.getEvents(false, 200, 0 )) and store $MonEvent in a checkbox list to select events I want to delete. But It doesn't  work when I retrieve my event with $request.getParameterValues('IdEntry')  
08:18 <Pbas> I thought I can pass and use $MonEvent.getEventId() but I don't know how to retrive my event object from event Id value (to use $xwiki.activitystream.deleteActivityEvent method after)

09:27 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

10:24 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <vmassol> would be nice if someone could reproduce https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12914 looks like an important bug  
11:32 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <ekarlso> has quit  
11:51 <ekarlso> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <Ramona2> has quit  
13:07 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <Ramona1> has quit  
13:41 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <vmassol> is that us: http://www.commitstrip.com/en/2014/05/07/the-truth-behind-open-source-apps ? :) I think we collaborate slightly more  
14:02 <cjd> I remember someone said that the collaboration which works best is that which requires the least collaboration...  
14:03 <vmassol> sure, if you can live with yourself that's the most efficient solution but not the one that gets the most work done  
14:03 <vmassol> :)  
14:03 <cjd> And then in breakingsmart the author pointed out that in a scenario of Scarcity, you need to agree on a forward path while in a scenario of Abundance, you don't  
14:03 <cjd> and software is fundimentally abundant so fork and merge is a perfectly fine model  
14:04 <cjd> but we are used to sitting in a meeting and deciding which way forward because this is how we did it all through the 20th century, when things were made of stone and steel, so we sometimes argue about what is the best way when the right answer is "do both and let the users choose"  
14:05 <cjd> anyway it's quite an interesting take on the matter  
14:09 <vmassol> well we are in a scarcity model  
14:09 <vmassol> because there's so much to do and so few devs and little time  
14:09 <vmassol> now in OSS luckily we don't do too many meetings :)  
14:10 <cjd> I think the definition of Abundance is that the most expensive item is the attention of the developer  
14:10 <cjd> So for managers, that's still true but for people writing code, the expensive item is their own time so they are in a state of Abundance  
14:11 <vmassol> yeah if 24 hours per day is plenty then yes  
14:12 <cjd> Abundance has a specific meaning, certainly computers and storage and processing still cost something  
14:12 <cjd> Abundance means that the most expensive thing is one's own creative effort  
14:12 <vmassol> in an ideal world yes  
14:13 <vmassol> unfotunately we all have agendas dicated by others than us  
14:13 <cjd> That's how breakingsmart defines it (IIRC)  
14:14 <cjd> Indeed so in business we still have a certain amount of scarcity but that doesn't mean everything is scarce  
14:14 <vmassol> the only real moment when you remove this are the holidays :)  
14:14 <vmassol> then you can work on whatever you wish ;)  
14:15 <vmassol> and I'm holidays starting now! (for 4 days at least)...  
14:15 <cjd> and nights and weekends  
14:15 <vmassol> yes  
14:15 <cjd> oh have lots of fun (or work, or whatever you like)  
14:15 <vmassol> but even that it not fully true  
14:15 <vmassol> when you have a wife and kids  
14:15 <vmassol> thanks  
14:15 <cjd> http://breakingsmart.com/season-1/  
14:15 <cjd> Highly recommended :)  
14:15 <vmassol> ah yes I remember you pointing this out in the past  
14:16 <vmassol> maybe I'll find the time to read it this time  
14:16 <vmassol> thanks  
14:16 <cjd> He also wrote an essay about the fox and the hedgehog which is a good essay about how to pick the right trends without getting swept up by fashion

16:25 <ol-ow2> Hi, how can i convert integer to hexa in velocity ?  
16:32 <cjd> has quit  
16:54 <ClemensR> there is a $numbertool.format(....) . This is actually the generic NumberTool from velocity.  
17:02 <ol-ow2> thanks
